description: From contraction of the phrase in as much (“to such a degree”), from Middle English in als mikel, a Northern form.

entries.meaning: (dated) In like degree; in like manner; to the same or similar degree; likewise. [14th c.]
examples: It seemed to me that the King was making uncomplimentary remarks about his dead father in the coffin, inasmuch to say that his father in the coffin was the same kind of man as what people were accusing me of being.
